Article Title: Threat from AI-generated deepfakes: If all can be faked, how do you know what‚Äôs real?
Article Text:
.

Deepfake Shock: Nirmala Sitharaman Reveals Fake Videos Of Herself Online, Warns Of AI‚Äôs Dark Side

Armour up with TOI to fight deepening threat of deepfakes





In a world where seeing is no longer believing, India is facing a new digital menace: AI-generated deepfakes.These hyper-realistic videos and audio clips don‚Äôt just distort reality. They manipulate public perception, spread misinformation and undermine trust in democracy itself.With 85.5 per cent of Indian households owning at least one smartphone, mobile phones have become India‚Äôs bank, classroom and television, making citizens more vulnerable to digital deception.During the 2024 elections, for instance, satirical deepfakes became a campaign tool of sorts. Apart from resurrecting dead leaders, it featured clips such as one that featured PM Narendra Modi dancing the garba with women and Kamal Nath dissing a popular welfare scheme.Though investigations and arrests followed, such videos blur the line between fact and fiction, risking the distortion of voter opinion and the integrity of the democratic process.Cybersecurity experts warn AI is also becoming a key tool in cybercrime: 80 per cent phishing campaigns in 2024 involved AI, with deepfakes exploited for scams.‚ÄúWhen you can fake images, audio, and video, how do you know if a real video is real? Suddenly, everything is in question,‚Äù said Hany Farid, professor at the University of California, Berkeley, in a TOI interview last year about the worrying rise in AI misuse.The deepfake threat extends beyond politics. Recently, finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman highlighted the misuse of AI to clone voices and produce fake videos impersonating her, warning of potential financial scams and the erosion of public trust. ‚ÄúI have seen several deepfake videos of myself being circulated online, manipulated to mislead citizens and distort facts,‚Äù Sitharaman said in Mumbai. ‚ÄúCriminals are using AI to mimic voices, clone identities, and create lifelike videos,‚Äù she added.Given that over 97% of India‚Äôs urban youth aged 15 to 29 owns a smartphone, the impact of such misinformation on a generation is worrying, say observers. ‚ÄúDeepfakes began in 2016. Back then, it was a joke. But the technology has only gotten better. Earlier, there were photoshopped face swaps. Now there are lipsync fakes,‚Äù said Prof. Farid, warning that the tech has become more refined, raising the risk of harassment of women through the use of non-consensual sexual imagery.In Nov 2023, actress Rashmika Mandanna became a victim of a viral deepfake video that superimposed her face on to compromising content, sparking widespread outrage. ‚ÄúThe very term ‚Äòdeepfake‚Äô comes from a Reddit user who in the early days of this technology used it to create porn,‚Äù said Farid, calling the new term ‚ÄòGenerative AI‚Äô clever ‚Äúrebranding‚Äù by the male-dominated tech industry.As AI evolves, India must strengthen legal frameworks, enhance digital literacy, and bring together minds across sectors to ensure safety, say experts. ‚ÄúWe need to label everything as real or not real,‚Äù said Farid, ‚ÄúWe need real disclosures.‚Äù To combat the deepening threat of deep fakes, TOI has already started armouring up. Watch out for our ‚ÄòDon‚Äôt Get Scammed‚Äô stories to stay informed and aware. After all, as Farid puts it, ‚Äúif you don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs real, how will you know what‚Äôs false‚Äù?
Article Summary: Ai-generated videos and audio clips don‚Äôt just distort reality. They manipulate public perception, spread misinformation and undermine trust in democracy itself. With 85.5 per cent of indian households owning at least one smartphone, mobile phones have become india‚Äôs bank, classroom and television.

Article Title: Kharif rice output reaches record 124.5 MT
Article Text:
Representative image

NEW DELHI: India's rice production during the 2025-26 kharif season that ended in Oct reached a record 124.5 million tonnes (MT), which is 1.7 MT (over 1%) more than the production of kharif rice last year, the agriculture ministry said on Wednesday. Output of pulses, oilseeds and cotton, however, marginally declined.The ministry's first advance estimates of kharif crops output put the total estimated foodgrain production for the 2025-26 season at around 173 MT, up from 169 MT a year earlier.These estimates are based on yield trends from previous years, other ground-level inputs, regional observations and data received from states.Revisions of output figures are made during subsequent estimates when the actual crop cutting experiment yield data becomes available. The ministry releases four advance estimates before final production figures for a crop year.Sowing of kharif crops starts at the onset of monsoon in June, and harvest generally begins in Oct."Excessive rainfall in some areas of the country affected crops, but most areas have benefited significantly from a good monsoon, leading to overall good crop growth," agriculture minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said.Maize production is estimated at 28 MT in 2025-26, up from nearly 25 MT the previous year. On the other hand, pulses production is estimated marginally lower at 7.4 MT compared to 7.7 MT in 2024-25. Similarly, oilseeds output is estimated at 27.5 MT, down from 28 MT the previous year.Cotton output is also pegged lower at 29.2 million bales (170 kg each) compared to 29.7 million bales a year earlier, while jute and mesta output is estimated at 8.3 million bales (180 kg each), down from 8.4 million bales.
Article Summary: India's rice production during the 2025-26 kharif season that ended in oct reached a record 124.5 million tonnes. Output of pulses, oilseeds and cotton, however, marginally declined. The total estimated foodgrain production for the 2025/26 season is around 173 mt.

Article Title: Stefon Diggs‚Äô partner Cardi B makes a bold statement after childbirth by transforming her baby‚Äôs umbilical cord into a gold pendant
Article Text:
(Image via Instagram: Cardi B with her baby boy)

Cardi B Debuts Newborn Son in Patriots Gear as She and Stefon Diggs Melt the Internet

Stefon Diggs‚Äô girlfriend Cardi B commemorates fourth baby‚Äôs birth with unique heart-shaped gold jewelry

Cardi B Turns Her Umbilical Cord Into GOLD!

More coverage on Cardi B and Stefon Diggs:

The placenta forms an extraordinary bond between mother and child, with the umbilical cord as their lifeline of silent conversation. When the baby arrives, the placenta follows, marking the end of this quiet connection. For nine months, mother and baby shared unspoken messages through this remarkable link, only to part with it at birth. But what if that connection could last a lifetime? That is probably the vision behind Mommy Made Encapsulation, a service that allows mothers to preserve their placenta forever. Such preservation was chosen by Cardi B , partner of New England Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs The couple recently welcomed a baby boy into their lives. Following the heartfelt tradition, she began with her third child, daughter Blossom, in October 2024, the Grammy-winning rapper chose to honor her fourth child with Diggs in November 2025 in a similar way. She entrusted Mommy Made Encapsulation to transform her pregnancy journey into cherished keepsakes, capturing the memorable moments when her baby was still growing inside her. The company crafted a heart-shaped gold pendant from the baby‚Äôs umbilical cord and turned the placenta into nourishing vitamins to support her post-partum recovery.Curious about how the gold pendant comes to life? The process begins with careful cleaning of the placenta, followed by a wash with blue dye that highlights its unique texture.After another rinse, the technician gently separates the placenta from the umbilical cord. The cord, now a striking blue, is shaped around a heart-shaped metal ring, with any extra length trimmed away. Finally, the piece is dipped in shimmering gold chrome, transforming it into a gleaming keepsake. The company describes it as a way to honor the first bond between mother and child. According to the company‚Äôs website, ‚ÄúThe umbilical cord keepsake is your baby‚Äôs umbilical cord dehydrated in the shape of a heart and then dipped in gold chrome. The end result looks and feels like metal and is the perfect way to honor the first connection you shared with your baby.‚Äù It costs $50.The ‚ÄúAM I THE DRAMA?‚Äù creator took things a step further by having her placenta turned into vitamin capsules. That‚Äôs not all. She also tried something called a Placenta Print. The process starts with cleaning the placenta and dyeing it blue to look like a tree. Then, a sheet of paper is pressed on top to make the company‚Äôs signature Placenta Print, which costs $65. Their website explains that the print is made by painting the placenta with food-grade coloring (one gets to choose the colors) and stamping it onto a 12-by-18-inch poster to create a Tree of Life painting. After the print is made, the placenta receives a fresh rinse before its transformation into capsules begins. Lemon juice, cayenne pepper, and ginger are added to the raw placenta.The website explains that the Traditional Chinese Medicine (TCM) method is used, with careful steaming at 220 degrees F for 30 minutes to ensure safety. Bacteria and viruses cannot survive at temperatures higher than 131 degrees F. Although, it loses some of the nutritional benefits when steamed, no research determins how much is lost. The placenta is a powerful organ, and all the mothers who have received capsules from Mommy Made Encapsulation still rave about its effects and feel its power. The placenta is gently steamed in specially designed steaming bags made up of heat-resistant, FDA-approved nylon, safe for cooking and free of BPA. Once steamed, the placenta is dried, ground into a fine powder, and sealed into capsules.Each placenta yields 160-180 pills, which, when taken regularly, can offer many benefits for new mothers, such as increased energy levels, reduced post-natal bleeding, lesser chance of baby blues, balanced mood and hormone levels, increased milk supply, lesser chance of post-partum depression, higher iron levels, uterus returning back to pre-pregnancy size faster, losing baby weight faster, and enhanced bonding experience with the baby. The nutrients found in placenta are vitamin B6, vitamin B12, vitamin E, iron, cytokines, and stem cells.The capsules are available in a variety of flavors, including strawberry, orange, bubblegum, lime, berry, grape, and a vegan option. According to the website, these capsules never expire. They just need to be kept at room temperature and in a dry place. The pills can be taken with other medications. The cost of encapsulation starts at $500. This never-heard-before ritual has even captured the curiosity of stars like Megan Fox and Vanessa Hudgens , who, like Cardi B, have embraced the trend of creating placenta keepsakes.Mommy Made Encapsulation was founded by mother-of-four Juliane Corona in 2016. Juliane and her team have encapsulated for over 40,000 moms, including celebrity clients such as Brittany Nassif, Jacqie Rivera, Alondra Dessy, Molly Brazy, Leslie Hernandez, Gemma Farrell, Adizia Benzon, Andrea Espada, Brittani Boren, and more.
Article Summary: The grammy-winning rapper entrusted mommy made encapsulation to transform her pregnancy journey into cherished keepsakes. The company crafted a heart-shaped gold pendant from the baby‚Äôs umbilical cord and turned the placenta into nourishing vitamins to support her post-partum recovery.

Article Title: "I want to date team owners": Kayla Nicole‚Äôs drama with Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift takes a new turn after her controversial remarks
Article Text:
Kayla Nicole makes new controversial remarks.(Image via Andrew Toth/Getty, Taylor Swift & Travis Kelce)

Travis Kelce‚Äôs ex, Kayla Nicole, opens up about her preferences in a man as she shades the Chiefs‚Äô player



Kayla Nicole has been brutally trolled by Taylor Swift‚Äôs fans



Kayla Nicole has dominated the headlines for the last few weeks ever since she targeted Travis Kelce ‚Äôs relationship with Taylor Swift in her parody music video for Halloween.While Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift has stayed away from the drama, Kayla Nicole sparked outrage as she opens up about her dating preferences.A few hours ago, Kayla Nicole appeared on the Harry Jowsey's Boyfriend Material podcast where she opened up about the type of men she wants to date.The popular social media influencer said, "I keep saying I don't want to date any more athletes‚Ä¶but I'm down to date the owners of the teams."Kayla Nicole added, "I'm really just open‚Ä¶the bar is really in hell these days."The Pre-Game With Kayla Nicole podcast host shared a quality she wants in her future boyfriend as she said, ‚ÄúA job, can we start there? You have work to do. You have something to do besidesThis has sparked outrage among fans as many feel Kayla Nicole‚Äôs remarks were controversial.In the last few weeks, Kayla Nicole has gotten brutally trolled after many of Taylor Swift‚Äôs fans dug up her old controversial posts on X.This prompted Kayla Nicole to delete her account on X and post an apology that read as, ‚ÄúI want to take a moment to apologize for the sincerely hurtful tweets I posted so many years ago‚Ä¶Seeing them resurface last week has been incredibly difficult, and reading them now, I‚Äôm ashamed that I ever thought or spoke that way‚Ä¶‚ÄùKayla Nicole added, ‚ÄúI have since deleted those tweets and my X account entirely because I refuse to keep that energy alive or contribute to a cycle of hate. The woman I am today would never use those words or express those kinds of views.‚ÄùKayla Nicole continued, ‚ÄúI take full responsibility for what I posted, and I‚Äôm truly sorry to anyone I may have hurt‚Ä¶My heart, values and perspective are completely rooted in empathy, love and respect for others.‚ÄùAlso Read: Taylor Swift pulled into new drama in Blake Lively‚Äôs legal mess with Justin Baldoni as Travis Kelce stays silent
Article Summary: Kayla nicole has dominated the headlines for the last few weeks ever since she targeted travis kelce ‚Äôs relationship with taylor swift in her parody music video for halloween. The popular social media influencer said, "i keep saying i don't want to date any more athletes‚Ä¶but i'm down to date the owners of the teams"

Article Title: Offset exposed for reportedly feeding fake Cardi B and Stefon Diggs stories through blogger friend
Article Text:
Offset allegedly bankrolls blogger to push fake Cardi B and Stefon Diggs narratives

A gossip blog publicly claims Offset‚Äôs blogger tried to push stories about Cardi B

‚ÄúDon‚Äôt come to me with info if you can‚Äôt back it up because you don‚Äôt want to be exposed.‚Äù

‚ÄúI need to make these people pay me for wasting my time.‚Äù

If you thought the Cardi B and Offset saga couldn‚Äôt get any messier, the internet just handed us a freshly brewed pot of drama. A popular gossip page has now stepped into the crossfire and not with speculation, but with receipts claiming that Offset‚Äôs alleged blogger friend has been sliding into their DMs all summer trying to plant tea about Cardi. And according to the blog? The tea wasn‚Äôt just cold‚Ä¶ it was straight-up false. The situation has fans whispering about a bigger pattern of ‚Äúnarrative planting‚Äù behind the scenes, and suddenly the storyline feels way deeper.The drama erupted after @sweetteatheblog posted a message accusing Offset of ‚Äúsending his blogger‚Äù to feed them questionable information about Cardi B. The blog names a woman ‚Äî Alexis, also known as Siana who they say has been in their DMs ‚Äúall summer‚Äù offering alleged insider tea.But according to the post, everything flipped when the page accidentally revealed her name in an earlier story. That‚Äôs when the blogger allegedly got angry and the blog realized something was off. The page makes it clear they‚Äôre not here for unverified gossip, especially when it involves someone they explicitly said they ‚Äúlike‚Äù Cardi B.The most shocking part of the post is the blog‚Äôs admission that the last piece of tea Alexis allegedly delivered turned out to be false.The blog even issued a public apology to Cardi and her team for the misinformation.In their words:And then the punchline:This single sentence sent fans spinning, especially those who already believed Offset might be behind certain narratives circulating online.For months, fans have speculated that Offset has been connected to certain gossip pages and content creators who consistently push unflattering narratives about Cardi B with Stefon Diggs. While none of this has been verified, the internet loves a pattern, and this new blog claim only fueled those suspicions.Users on X began stitching together alleged timelines, pointing out how certain stories conveniently aligned with Offset‚Äôs side of the drama. Some even revisited Cardi‚Äôs own livestream earlier this year where she accused Offset of using ‚Äúblogger friends‚Äù to stir mess around her name.This new receipt acted like gasoline on an already-lit fire.The breakup between Cardi B and Offset has already played out publicly, with leaked texts, explosive accusations, and messy social posts. But this is the first time a blog itself has publicly accused someone allegedly tied to Offset of trying to use their platform to harm Cardi‚Äôs image.Also read - Fans say Drake Maye and Ann Michael are ‚ÄúThe King and Queen of New England‚Äù after viral Thanksgiving charity moment
Article Summary: A gossip blog publicly claims offset‚Äôs blogger tried to push stories about cardi b. The blog names a woman ‚Äî alexis, also known as siana ‚Äî who they say has been in their dms ‚Äúall summer‚Äù the blog even issued a public apology to cardi and her team for the misinformation.

Article Title: SteveWillDoIt sparks controversy by calling Mike Majlak the biggest loser ever after heated Logan Paul podcast moment
Article Text:
SteveWillDoIt sparks controversy by calling Mike Majlak the biggest loser ever after heated Logan Paul podcast moment (Image via Getty)

SteveWillDoIt walks off the set as Logan Paul and Mike Majlak react on camera





American YouTuber SteveWillDoIt called Mike Majlak the ‚Äúbiggest loser ever‚Äù on Instagram after he was reportedly kicked off Logan Paul‚Äôs podcast. According to Unilad, Steve went on Impaulsive to share that he was now unbanned from YouTube. But the talk turned messy very fast. The show got tense, the mood changed, and Steve soon looked unhappy. Around 40 minutes into the recording, he pushed his mic away and stood up. He even shook hands with Logan Paul and Mike Majlak as if he wanted to leave.Mike Majlak told him the show was not done yet, but Steve said he was done. Soon after this moment, Steve went on Instagram and posted stories calling Mike Majlak the ‚Äúbiggest loser ever.‚Äù He also said Mike was a bad person. These stories spread fast across social media. One post about the drama was shared on X by the user @viewsceo, and the clip got more than 200,000 views and 2,200 likes. Many people gave their own take on the fight.Reports by Unilad say the interview started going wrong around the 40-minute mark. People on the set felt the energy change. Steve moved his mic away and looked ready to walk out.This was when Mike Majlak stepped in and told him the podcast was still going on.SteveWillDoIt then challenged the hosts to a padel game and even put his $40,000 watch on the line, as reported by Dexerto. After this, Steve said a few things that were censored in the video. Whatever he said did not sit well with Logan Paul.Logan Paul told him,‚ÄúSteve, I have a line. I think you hit that line. I need you to chill a little bit.‚ÄùLogan also said he could take jokes, but Steve needed to be careful.Steve then said something else, but that part was censored too. Mike Majlak quickly ended the interview. He said,‚ÄúAlright, grab him, let‚Äôs go, it‚Äôs done. Thank you for coming on, Steve.‚ÄùAfter Steve walked out, Logan Paul looked shocked. He even said he wondered how Steve never got ‚Äúbeat up.‚Äù Logan also said he would have ‚Äúslapped‚Äù Steve if Steve was not invited to the show.As of now, Logan Paul and Mike Majlak have not given any public reply to SteveWillDoIt‚Äôs Instagram posts. Many viewers, however, wrote in the comments that they supported Steve, even though the hosts seemed upset.Also Read: What Happened Between SteveWillDoIt And Logan Paul On The Impaulsive Podcast After The MrBeast Comments?
Article Summary: American youtuber stevewilldoit called mike majlak the ‚Äúbiggest loser ever‚Äù on instagram after he was reportedly kicked off logan paul‚Äôs podcast. Steve went on impaulsive to share that he was now unbanned from youtube. But the talk turned messy very fast. The show got tense, the mood changed, and steve soon looked unhappy.

Article Title: Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff says he's never going to use ChatGPT again: It feels like ...
Article Text:
Tech leaders acknowledge Gemini 3.0 success





OpenAI's Master Plan for India





Salesforce CEO Mark Benioff has declared that he will not use ChatGPT, the AI chatbot developed by Microsoft-backed AI company OpenAI . His comments came after he used Google‚Äôs latest AI model, Gemini 3.0, stating that a two-hour experience with Google‚Äôs new model has convinced him to switch permanently. Google CEO Sundar Pichai termed the Gemini 3 as the company‚Äôs ‚Äúmost intelligent model, that combines all of Gemini‚Äôs capabilities together so you can bring any idea to life. ‚ÄùIn a post on X, Benioff claimed that Gemini 3.0 has brought a monumental shift in the AI landscape. The CEO specifically praised Gemini 3‚Äôs performance across multiple modalities, noting key improvements in reasoning, speed, image quality, and video processing as the compelling factors behind his decision.‚ÄúHoly shit. I‚Äôve used ChatGPT every day for 3 years. Just spent 2 hours on Gemini 3. I‚Äôm not going back. The leap is insane ‚Äî reasoning, speed, images, video‚Ä¶ everything is sharper and faster. It feels like the world just changed, again. ‚ù§Ô∏è ü§ñ‚ÄùBenioff‚Äôs endorsement highlights the competitive pressure now facing OpenAI as models from rival tech giants like Google make significant advances. Tesla CEO Elon Musk and even OpenAI chief executive Sam Altman praised Pichai following the launch of Gemini 3.The xAI founder said ‚ÄúCongrats‚Äù on Pichai‚Äôs "Geminiii" announcement on X, and ‚ÄúNice Work‚Äù to Demis Hassabis, the chief of DeepMind. Altman posted ‚ÄúCongrats to Google on Gemini 3! Looks like a great model.‚ÄùAltman even noted potential ‚Äútemporary economic headwinds‚Äù in an internal memo but expressed confidence in OpenAl‚Äôs rapid progress and leadership in the Al race.‚ÄúWe have built enough strength as a company to weather great models shipping elsewhere competition... (so), having most of our research team focused on really getting to superintelligence is critically important,‚Äù Altman wrote in the internal memo.Stripe CEO Patrick Collison also posted on X that Gemini 3 built him an ‚Äúinteractive web page summarising 10 breakthroughs in genetics,‚Äù and called it ‚Äúpretty cool.‚Äù
Article Summary: Salesforce ceo mark benioff has declared that he will not use chatgpt, the ai chatbot developed by microsoft-backed ai company openai. His comments came after he used google‚Äôs latest ai model, gemini 3.0, stating that a two-hour experience has convinced him to switch permanently.

Article Title: How to restore old photos with Google Nano Banana Pro: A prompt guide and expert tips
Article Text:
Why Google Nano Banana Pro is ideal for restoring old photos

Google‚Äôs New AI Is BANANAS: How To Use Gemini Nano Banana

How to use Google Nano Banana Pro to restore old photos with the right prompts

General restoration prompt:

Portrait restoration prompt:

Colour correction prompt:

Severely damaged photo prompt:

Tips to restore old photos with Google Nano Banana Pro without losing authenticity

Avoid over-enhancing

Check historical colour references

Preserve original shadows

Inspect edges and background details

Common mistakes when restoring old photos with Google Nano Banana Pro

Also read|





There is something magical about rediscovering an old, worn photograph. The soft yellows, the creases, the fading edges and the stubborn scratches hold stories that feel too precious to lose. Until recently, restoring these photos required hours of painstaking manual editing. Now Google Nano Banana Pro has made that process far easier. With the right prompts and a bit of creative direction, you can revive portraits, repair damage, and bring lost details back to life in a way that looks natural and polished. Whether you are working with a family album or a treasured vintage snapshot, this tool gives you professional level results with far less effort.Google Nano Banana Pro uses advanced diffusion modelling and context-aware reconstruction. In simple terms, it analyses each pixel, predicts missing details and rebuilds textures so the restored image looks authentic rather than overly sharpened. It also understands lighting, skin tones, shadows and colour balance, which makes it one of the most reliable tools for repairing vintage portraits. Instead of plastic-looking edits, you get subtle, human-like restoration that respects the original photo.The model also handles very damaged images. Torn edges, fold marks, grainy patches and faded backgrounds can be reconstructed automatically. For photos from the 70s and 80s, which often have tinted colour casts, the tool balances hues without making the image look artificial.Using this model effectively comes down to guiding it with clear prompts. Here are prompt structures that work well for damaged or faded photos:‚ÄúRestore this old photograph with natural colours, clean details and accurate lighting. Remove scratches, stains and noise while keeping the original style.‚Äù‚ÄúReconstruct the face gently, retain natural skin texture, preserve original expressions and repair damaged areas without over-smoothing.‚Äù‚ÄúNeutralise yellow tint, improve contrast, balance highlights and shadows, and restore film-like tones.‚Äù‚ÄúRebuild missing or torn sections, reconstruct textures, recover facial features accurately and maintain the vintage feel of the image.‚ÄùYou can also add extra artistic instructions such as ‚Äúkeep grain minimal‚Äù or ‚Äúretain film quality‚Äù. The more specific you are, the more consistent the results.To ensure your restored photos look natural, keep these expert guidelines in mind:It is tempting to eliminate all grain, but older photographs naturally have texture. Leave a little grain to maintain the vintage character.For very old family photographs, match the restored colours with reference images from that era. For example, mid-century colour palettes often used softer reds and muted greens.Shadows anchor a photograph. If you remove too many shadows or highlights, the restored image may look flat. Let the model repair damage, but keep the original lighting structure intact.While the model handles most reconstruction automatically, sometimes background objects can appear too clean. Adjusting the prompt to ‚Äúpreserve background imperfections‚Äù can solve this.Many beginners make the error of giving vague prompts like ‚Äúfix this photo‚Äù. This causes incorrect smoothing, unnatural facial features or oddly bright colours. Another mistake is using portrait prompts for landscape images, which can distort objects. Over-sharpening is also common, resulting in a digital rather than vintage look. Always compare the original and restored versions side by side to ensure the emotional tone remains the same. This helps you refine edits, preserve important details, and maintain the original atmosphere that gives the photograph its distinctive authenticity.Photo restoration is more than fixing pixels. It is a way of honouring memories that might otherwise fade. With Google Nano Banana Pro and the right prompt strategy, you can bring old pictures back to life while preserving their history and charm. A few careful edits and a well-structured prompt are often all it takes to rebuild details, refresh colours and revive treasured moments. If you have a box of old photographs waiting to be restored, this tool is a gentle and precise way to begin.
Article Summary: Google nano banana pro uses advanced diffusion modelling and context-aware reconstruction. It analyses each pixel, predicts missing details and rebuilds textures so the restored image looks authentic rather than overly sharpened. For photos from the 70s and 80s, which often have tinted colour casts, the tool balances hues without making the image look artificial.

Article Title: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon calls Nvidia an 'unbelievable‚Äô company, but warns some people will ‚Ä¶
Article Text:
AI is real and not a passing trend

Nvidia‚Äôs historic milestone



JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon doesn‚Äôt sugarcoat AI impact on jobs





JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon has now hailed Nvidia as an unbelievable company and has also cautioned investors that some artificial intelligence stocks may be trading at an unsustainable levels. Speaking with CNN‚Äôs Erin Burnett, Dimon said that the US remains the ‚Äòmost prosperous‚Äô economy in the world. He adds that the US economy is supported by diverse and deep capital markets including venture capital, private credit and hedge funds. ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no question some people will lose money,‚Äù Dimon said, drawing parallels to the dot-com era. ‚ÄúBut mankind should benefit,‚Äù he added, emphasising that the underlying technology is real and transformative‚Äîeven if valuations are currently inflated.Dimon emphasized that AI is a genuine productivity revolution, comparing its current stage to the early days of the Internet. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs almost at the beginning,‚Äù he said, noting that while not every company will succeed, AI will produce transformative winners just as the internet gave rise to Google, Facebook, and Amazon.Dimon acknowledged that valuations in the AI sector may be inflated, but stressed that the underlying technology will reshape industries and improve lives.‚ÄúMankind should benefit,‚Äù he said, even if ‚Äúvaluations today may be too high for some of these folks.‚ÄùIn October 2025, Nvidia became the first company in history to surpass a $5 trillion market valuation. Its market cap currently stands at $4.74 trillion, underscoring its dominance in the AI chip market. Dimon‚Äôs remarks came shortly after Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang predicted that China will win the AI race, a claim that drew sharp pushback from President Donald Trump, who vowed the U.S. would not allow other nations access to Nvidia‚Äôs most advanced chips.In another interview with Bloomberg TV, Dimon talked about the impact of AI on the job market. ‚ÄúPeople shouldn‚Äôt put their head in the sand. It is going to affect jobs,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúAI will enhance some aspects of work, but also eliminate some jobs.‚Äù However, Dimon also stressed on the fact that JPMorgan is focused on retaining and redeploying employees whose roles are impacted by automation. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll have more jobs, but there‚Äôll probably be less jobs in certain functions,‚Äù Dimon added. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre better off being way ahead of the curve,‚Äù Dimon added.Dimon also added that the bank has invested about $2 billion as an annual investment in AI and is already making $2 billion in direct benefits. This includes the headcount reductions and operational savings. ‚ÄúWe know about $2 billion of actual cost saves,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs the tip of the iceberg.‚Äù
Article Summary: Jpmorgan chase ceo jamie dimon has hailed nvidia as an unbelievable company. He has also cautioned investors that some artificial intelligence stocks may be trading at an unsustainable levels. Dimon emphasized that ai is a genuine productivity revolution, comparing its current stage to the early days of the internet.

Article Text:

How do I play the game?

Are hints available?

Can I play NYT Connections for free?

What skills does the game improve?





The New York Times‚Äô Connections has quickly become a favourite among word puzzle enthusiasts, blending the addictive simplicity of Wordle with more complex challenges in logic and pattern recognition. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups. Success depends on identifying subtle connections, associations, and clever wordplay, making the game both fun and mentally stimulating. For puzzle lovers looking to test their skills, the November 26, 2025 edition (game #899) offers an ideal mix of challenge and insight, encouraging lateral thinking, careful observation, and strategic reasoning. Connections continues to captivate a global audience as a daily exercise in cognitive skill and mental agility.NYT Connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Unlike standard word games, players must detect subtle links between words, which can range from obvious to highly nuanced or abstract. The game is freely available on mobile devices and desktop platforms, allowing enthusiasts to play anytime, anywhere, at their convenience.Its combination of easy-to-understand mechanics, challenging puzzles, and complex problem-solving has turned it into a daily ritual for many. The game‚Äôs structure encourages players to sharpen their pattern recognition, develop strategic thinking, improve memory retention, and enjoy a mental workout while having fun.To assist players without giving away the answers directly, here are strategic hints for November 26, 2025:These hints guide players toward recognising patterns, encouraging logical deduction and strategic grouping without removing the challenge entirely.For game #899, the four categories are specifically:Success in the game depends on carefully observing wordplay, spotting subtle connections, and applying strategic reasoning to find the correct groupings.For those ready to review their solutions or learn from the puzzle logic, the complete answers for game #899 are:Connections continues to captivate players worldwide, turning each puzzle into a thrilling hunt for hidden patterns, where every correct grouping sparks a moment of ‚Äúaha!‚Äù and keeps the mind sharp for the next challenge.Words are presented in a 4x4 grid. Identify patterns or associations to sort them into four correct categories.Yes, the game provides subtle hints to guide players without revealing the answers outright.Yes, it is available for free on both mobile devices and desktop platforms.It sharpens pattern recognition, logical thinking, lateral reasoning, and problem-solving skills.
Article Summary: Nyt connections is a captivating word association game designed to test analytical thinking, lateral reasoning, and cognitive flexibility. Each day, players face 16 seemingly random words arranged in a 4x4 grid, tasked with sorting them into four distinct thematic groups.

Article Title: iQoo 15 with Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip, 2K display launched: Price in India, specifications and all you need to know
Article Text:
iQoo 15 price in India and availability



Rs 7,000 discount, applicable either as an instant bank offer across ICICI, Axis, and HDFC banks or as an exchange discount

No cost EMI for up to 24 months

An additional Rs 1,000 coupon discount for eligible customers

iQoo 15 specifications







iQoo 15 is now official. iQoo has launched its premium flagship smartphone, the iQoo 15, offering top-of-the-line hardware with gaming software capabilities aimed at young professionals. The smartphone features the Samsung 2K M14 LEAD OLED display, which is said to be coming to an Android smartphone for the first time. It offers 2600 nits (HBM) and 6000 nits local peak brightness for legibility under the harsh sun. Under the hood is the Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC and iQOO‚Äôs proprietary Supercomputing Chip Q3 for speed and efficiency.The iQoo 15 is priced at Rs 72,999 for the 12GB + 256GB variant and Rs 79,999 for the 16GB + 512GB variant. The phone will be offered in two colour options: matte black Alpha Edition and Legend Edition in white, featuring the new tri-color rhombus pattern inspired by motorsport racing flags.Pre-booking starts from November 27, 12 noon. The iQoo 15 will go on sale starting December 1, on Amazon.in, iQoo e-store, and stores near you, and vivo exclusive stores.Customers can avail the following exciting early bird offers on their iQoo 15 purchase:iQoo 15 sports Samsung‚Äôs 2K M14 LEAD OLED display ‚Äì introduced for the first time on any Android smartphone.It is claimed to offer up to 6000 nits local peak brightness and 2600 nits HBM. There‚Äôs 144Hz adaptive refresh rate, Dolby Vision certification, and T√úV Rheinland double eye protection certification.Under the hood is Qualcomm‚Äôs Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 SoC paired with up to 16GB of LPDDR5X Ultra 9600 Mbps RAM, UFS 4.1 storage, and up to 37% NPU performance boost through on-device Agentic AI. The iQoo 15 also gets the company‚Äôs proprietary SuperComputing Chip Q3 for mobile graphics and computational efficiency.According to the company, the phone comes with India's largest 8K Single Layer VC Cooling System. iQOO 15 will bring OriginOS 6 based on Android 16 out of the box. iQoo is offering 5 years of OS updates and 7 years of security patches.iQoo 15 gets a triple 50MP Camera System with a 50MP Sony IMX921 VCS main sensor, 50MP ultra-wide lens, and a flagship 50MP 3X Telephoto Periscope camera. It packs a 7,000mAh silicon anode battery with 100W FlashCharge, and 40W wireless charging introduced for the first time in an iQOO flagship smartphone.
Article Summary: Iqoo has launched its premium flagship smartphone, the iqoo 15. The smartphone features the samsung 2k m14 lead oled display, which is said to be coming to an android smartphone for the first time. Under the hood is the snapdragon 8 elite gen 5 soc and iqoo‚Äôs proprietary supercomputing chip q3 for speed and efficiency.

Article Title: Apple CEO Tim Cook may not be retiring soon, here‚Äôs why
Article Text:
Apple CEO Tim Cook Confirms Majority Of iPhones Sold In U.S. Now Made In India

Tim Cook to reportedly retire in 2026

Tim Cook‚Äôs continued leadership

What‚Äôs next for Apple‚Äôs executive team





Apple CEO Tim Cook may not be retiring anytime soon. Earlier this month, a report by Financial Times revealed that Tim Cook is planning to step down as soon as next year. However, a new report by Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman suggests that Cook has no plans of stepping down in the near future. Apple has been preparing for a leadership transition for quite some time. In 2024, Bloomberg revealed that Apple‚Äôs senior vice president of hardware engineering John Ternus was at the center of succession discussions. Ternus the youngest member of Apple‚Äôs executive team looks after the hardware division and is also widely respected by Apple CEO Tim Cook and former COO Jeff Williams.Then in October this year, Bloomberg suggests that the internal spotlight on Ternus was ‚Äòintensifying‚Äô, making him the likely candidate to succeed Cook.Earlier this month, a report by Financial Times revealed that Apple CEO Tim Cook may step down from his position in between January and June 2026. As per the report, the current CEO Tim Cook is said to be succeeded by John Ternus, Apple‚Äôs senior vice-president of hardware engineering. However, no final decision has been made, sources told the publication. They also stressed that the transition plans are not tied to Apple‚Äôs current performance, as the company heads into what is expected to be a strong holiday season for iPhone sales.Taking about this upcoming transition, Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman wrote, ‚ÄúBased on everything I‚Äôve learned in recent weeks, I don‚Äôt believe a departure by the middle of next year is likely.‚Äù This means there are less chances of Tim Cook retiring anytime soon.Cook, who turned 65 this month, took over as CEO in 2011 after co-founder Steve Jobs died. Under his leadership, Apple‚Äôs valuation has climbed from around $350 billion to $4 trillion. Despite strong results last month, Apple‚Äôs roughly 12% stock rise this year trails rivals like Alphabet, Nvidia and Microsoft, which have surged on AI momentum.‚ÄúYes, Apple will eventually have a new leader. And, yes, it‚Äôs probably Ternus. But unless there is some unexpected event that forces Cook to step down sooner than planned, that moment is not at hand. But there still may be significant movement on Apple‚Äôs executive team. As I recently reported, silicon chief Johny Srouji is seriously evaluating his future at the company, while Apple has been on the hunt for a new AI leader,‚Äù said Bloomberg‚Äôs Mark Gurman.While the retirement of Apple CEO Tim Cook is not imminent, Bloomberg reveals that the company will still witness some leadership changes in the coming weeks. As per the report,Apple‚Äôs silicon chief, Johny Srouji may be evaluating his future at the company. Also, Apple is actively looking for a new AI leader in order to strengthen its position in generative AI sector.
Article Summary: Earlier this month, a report by financial times revealed that tim cook is planning to step down as soon as next year. However, a new report by bloomberg‚Äôs mark gurman suggests that cook has no plans of stepping down in the near future.

Article Title: Google Meet down: Thousands of users not able to join meetings
Article Text:
What does '502. That‚Äôs an error' mean

Server trouble:

Failed connection:

Temporary outage:

Google Meet outage : What the company said



We are experiencing an issue with Google Meet beginning on Tuesday, 2025-11-25 21:41 PST.

Our engineering team continues to investigate the issue and work on a mitigation strategy.

We will provide an update by Wednesday, 2025-11-26 02:00 PST with current details.

We apologize to all who are affected by the disruption.





Google Meet, Google‚Äôs video conferencing platform is experiencing widespread outage. Thousands of Google Meet users in India were not able to join meetings. According to outage tracking website, DownDetector, 65% users were not able to access the website for Google Meet. Around 33% users complained of server connection issue and 2% had issues with the video quality.According to Downdetector, reports of issues surged around midday, with users citing ‚Äú502 error‚Äù messages and failed attempts to connect to ongoing meetings. The outage mainly affected users in India and some users in other countries also reported the issues. Many users also complained of log in issues and many were also not able to join the scheduled calls including work calls, online classes and other virtual events.At its peak, about 1700 people in India reported problems with the app. Downdetector suggests that the issue has now been resolved as the number of reports are showing a downward curve.In easier words, '502 Bad Gateway' error in Google Meet means that there is a temporary server communication failure.There may three reasons for it:The primary issue is typically on Google's side, not your personal device or internet connection.In this case, restarting your machine or router won't solve the problem.Google's servers (or an intermediary system required to connect you to the service) temporarily failed to get a valid response from the backend service needed to load your meeting.The platform cannot load or connect you to the meeting at that moment. A bug could have broken the process, causing a server-side problem. This means that the error is temporary and generally resolves once Google restores stability to the service.As of Wednesday afternoon, Google had not issued a detailed statement on the cause of the outage. The company‚Äôs status dashboard showed service disruptions, but no timeline for resolution was provided.The company has update the staus page at 2:08 pm IST with this message:
Article Summary: Google‚Äôs video conferencing platform is experiencing widespread outage. Thousands of google meet users in india were not able to join meetings. Reports of issues surged around midday, with users citing ‚Äú502 error‚Äù messages and failed attempts to connect to ongoing meetings.

Article Title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman to employees in internal memo: Google‚Äôs AI success can create‚Ä¶
Article Text:
OpenAI CEO Sam Altman acknowledges Google's AI advancements, noting potential temporary economic challenges but expressing confidence in OpenAI's rapid progress. Despite concerns about slowing ChatGPT engagement, Altman remains optimistic about the company's long-term vision for superintelligence and its strategic partnerships, including one with Foxconn to bolster US AI infrastructure.

"create some temporary economic headwinds for our company."

"catching up fast"

What Sam Altman said OpenAI employees about the company‚Äôs biggest rivals

OpenAI's Master Plan for India

‚ÄúWe have built enough strength as a company to weather great models shipping elsewhere competition... (so), having most of our research team focused on really getting to superintelligence is critically important,‚Äù

‚ÄúIt s**ks that we have to do so many hard things at the same time ‚Äî the best research lab, the best AI infrastructure company, and the best AI platform/product company ‚Äî but such is our lot in life. And I wouldn't trade positions with any other company,‚Äù

‚ÄúThis partnership is a step toward ensuring the core technologies of the AI era are built here [US],‚Äù and added that AI infrastructure production presents a

‚Äúgenerational opportunity to reindustrialise America.‚Äù

"is uniquely positioned to support OpenAI‚Äôs mission with trusted, scalable infrastructure."

"Congrats to Google on Gemini 3! Looks like a great model," he said after the launch. Pichai replied with 'folded hands' emoji.





ChatGPT maker OpenAI 's CEO Sam Altman is optimistic about Google 's recent successes in artificial intelligence (AI) technology. In a recent internal memo to colleagues, Altman acknowledged that the AI startup rival's success couldHowever, Altman reassured that OpenAI isand anticipates emerging as the leader in the AI race. It's important to note that Altman's memo was written before Google's Gemini 3 was released, a model the tech giant has described as its most capable to date. Software developers have reported that the new model performed well on tasks such as automating website and product design and writing code, which is a lucrative revenue stream for OpenAI and its competitors, such as Anthropic.Concerns about OpenAI's slowing growth arose late this summer. During a recent quarterly earnings call with investors, the company‚Äôs CFO, Sarah Friar, confirmed that user engagement with the popular AI chatbot ChatGPT had cooled, despite the company's otherwise positive financial results.According to a report by The Information (as seen by The Economic Times), Sam Altman's memo noted that competitors such as Google and Anthropic are narrowing the gap in the AI raceAnthropic‚Äôs Claude model generates computer code for various tasks using conversational prompts.Meanwhile, Google has been integrating its Gemini AI chatbot into its search app, productivity tools and other services. However, recently, Claude gained a new challenger from OpenAI with the introduction of Codex.Google also holds an economic advantage. OpenAI‚Äôs growth has been rapid and the company now carries a valuation of around $500 billion as a for-profit entity. It is expected to bring in about $13 billion in revenue, but is estimated to burn roughly $100 billion in its push toward superintelligence.With a market value of about $3.5 trillion, Google reported free cash flow of over $70 billion in the past four quarters. A significant portion of this comes from providing cloud services to OpenAI, Anthropic and other competitors.Sam Altman also encouraged OpenAI employees to stay confident and focus on the company's larger goals.Altman wrote in the internal memo.Altman added.Recently, OpenAI partnered with Apple's biggest suuplier Foxconn to design and build AI data-centre components in the US. Under this partnership, OpenAI will help develop future server systems and may purchase Foxconn-produced hardware in the coming days. Altman noted that this collaboration can strengthen American manufacturing infrastructure.Commenting on the partnership, Altman said:Foxconn will join OpenAI‚Äôs supply chain to manufacture AI-related hardware in a more American way. The company, known for iPhone assembly, also manufactures AI servers and supplies components to Nvidia.Commenting on the partnership, Foxconn chairman Young Liu said that the companyIn September, Oracle also inked a $300 billion deal with ChatGPT maker OpenAI. Since then, the company has shed more than $300 billion in market value, and Wall Street is starting to wonder if a partnership between the companies will bring returns or pose risks for Oracle.
Article Summary: Openai ceo sam altman acknowledges google's ai advancements, noting potential temporary economic challenges but expressing confidence in openai's rapid progress. Despite concerns about slowing chatgpt engagement, altman remains optimistic about the company's long-term vision for superintelligence.

Article Title: Now, with 5G smartphones, 25 ex-Maoists log into new life in Chhattisgarh
Article Text:
RAIPUR:

Giving a digital lifeline and access into mainstream society to the former Maoists who have chosen rehabilitation, Bastar's Sukma district administration distributed high-end 5G smartphones to 25 former cadres housed at govt's Naxal rehabilitation centre.Officials described the move as a ‚Äúpractical and humane‚Äù step under Chhattisgarh‚Äôs rehabilitation policy, aimed at ensuring that those who have left the path of violence are not left behind in an increasingly digital world. This is the same group of former Maoists whom the home minister Vijay Sharma met recently at the camp on Nov 22 and told them they should become 'technologically empowered.'Speaking to TOI, Sukma SP Kiran Chavan said that the initiative has been taken by state govt and 25 former cadres were given smartphones worth Rs 10,000 mobile so that they can watch cricket matches, movies. The basic purpose is that they feel empowered and connected to the mainstream. These cadres had surrendered about three-four months back, many others will also be given mobile phones, SP said.The distribution was carried out under the supervision of Collector Devesh Kumar Dhruv and Sukma SP.Officials said the devices, equipped with features such as a 50-megapixel dual camera and a 5,000 mAh fast-charging battery, are intended to be more than just communication tools.With internet access, the former Maoists will now be able to connect to online education platforms, skill-development courses, government portals and digital payments ‚Äî all seen as crucial stepping stones for rebuilding their lives, officials said in a statement.‚ÄúThis is not just about giving a phone; it is about opening a window to opportunities,‚Äù a senior district official said, adding that the administration wants rehabilitated cadres to be able to search for jobs, learn new skills, stay updated on government schemes and explore options for self-employment, including in agriculture and small businesses.Alongside intensified operations in the forests, the state has been trying to offer credible alternatives ‚Äî housing, livelihood support, training and social acceptance ‚Äî to those willing to surrender. Officials said the smartphones will help the surrendered cadres keep in regular touch with family members and officials, reducing isolation and strengthening their sense of security and inclusion.Access to verified information is also expected to counter rumours, fear, and the influence of remaining underground Maoist networks. The district administration has clarified that the remaining residents of the rehabilitation centre will also be provided similar 5G smartphones ‚Äúvery soon‚Äù.‚ÄúTechnology can become a bridge ‚Äî from the life they are leaving behind to the life they are trying to build,‚Äù another official said, stressing that the success of rehabilitation depends not just on financial assistance but on equipping people to stand on their own feet. Sukma, one of the core districts of the erstwhile Maoist stronghold in south Bastar, has in recent months seen a rising number of surrenders under the state‚Äôs rehabilitation policy.By putting 5G-enabled smartphones in the hands of surrendered cadres, the administration is hoping to send out a dual message across the conflict zone: that the state is serious both about ending violence and about supporting those who choose to leave it behind, officials said. For now, the Sukma rehabilitation centre ‚Äî once home to men and women who lived off the grid in the forests ‚Äî is slowly turning into a space where life after extremism increasingly runs through touchscreens, apps and online classrooms.
Article Summary: 25 former maoists were given smartphones worth rs 10,000 mobile so that they can watch cricket matches, movies. The basic purpose is that they feel empowered and connected to the mainstream. These cadres had surrendered about three-four months back, many others will also be given mobile phones, sp said.

Article Title: MLB trade rumors: Baltimore Orioles predicted to bag $210 million Toronto Blue Jays superstar to replace Grayson Rodriguez
Article Text:
FILE - Baltimore Orioles starting pitcher Grayson Rodriguez throws during the first inning of a baseball game against the Toronto Blue Jays, July 31, 2024, in Baltimore. (AP Photo/Stephanie Scarbrough, File)

Baltimore Orioles

Why Dylan Cease has surfaced as Baltimore Orioles‚Äôs top target

Dylan Cease‚Äôs 2025 season performance

Dylan Cease of San Diego Padres (Image via Getty)

Statistic Value ERA



4.55



Strikeouts



215



WHIP



1.327



Innings Pitched



168



FIP



3.56



K/9



11.5





Baltimore Orioles‚Äô rotation needs after key departures

What Dylan Cease offers Baltimore

New York Yankees at Baltimore Orioles (Image via Imagn)

Understanding Cease‚Äôs ‚Äútrend‚Äù season pattern

Why a Cease‚ÄìOrioles union makes sense

What comes next for Baltimore

Themay be approaching a pivotal offseason, and league observers believe the front office could be preparing a significant move. With criticism mounting around small-market teams minimizing payroll while profits rise, Baltimore finds itself at a crossroad. After a season that pushed them close to that category, the Orioles are being urged by analysts to make a decisive splash - and that splash may come in the form of San Diego Padres star Dylan Cease.According to FanSided‚Äôs Christopher Kline, Baltimore‚Äôs most urgent need is an ace-caliber starter capable of anchoring the rotation following major offseason losses. He wrote, ‚ÄúThe Baltimore Orioles need an ace, especially with Zach Eflin hitting the open market and Grayson Rodriguez shipped to Anaheim‚Ä¶ Dylan Cease has his bouts of inconsistency, but he‚Äôs a strikeout machine, and he profiles as one of the most dominant arms in MLB when he‚Äôs firing on all cylinders. ‚Äù (H/t: Sporting News)Dylan Cease, a former Cy Young candidate entering the market at roughly $13.75 million, brings one of the most intriguing profiles among available pitchers. His high-ceiling, high-variance track record has long made him a difficult player to project, but evaluators agree: at his best, Cease is one of the most overpowering arms in baseball.Here is a look at his most recent campaign:Those numbers illustrate why teams remain attracted to him.While the ERA does not reflect ace-level consistency, his advanced metrics - especially the 3.56 FIP and elite strikeout rate - suggest stronger performance beneath the surface. Cease still ranks among the most dominant arms when he is fully dialed in.Baltimore Orioles‚Äô rotation picture has shifted quickly:‚Ä¢ Zach Eflin is hitting free agency‚Ä¢ Grayson Rodriguez has been traded to the Anaheim Angels‚Ä¢ Last winter‚Äôs failed bid for Corbin Burnes showed the club was willing to spend - but couldn‚Äôt close the dealThis offseason brings renewed urgency. With Rodriguez gone, the Orioles lack a dependable set-and-forget ace, increasing the likelihood they make an assertive push for a frontline starter.If the Orioles follow Kline‚Äôs prediction, Dylan Cease would bring:‚Ä¢ A swing-and-miss profile rarely found in free agency‚Ä¢ A strong underlying analytical foundation‚Ä¢ A proven track record of contending for major awards‚Ä¢ The potential to immediately become Baltimore‚Äôs No. 1 starterOne of the more interesting aspects of Cease‚Äôs career is the season-to-season volatility. Analysts often point out a pattern:‚Ä¢ One season: Cy Young candidate‚Ä¢ Next season: mid-rotation starter‚Ä¢ Following season: major bounce-backFollowing that cycle, the upcoming year is projected to be one of his ‚Äúgood‚Äù seasons, further boosting interest from teams needing upside at the top of the rotation. Baltimore, entering 2026 with expectations but lacking certainty on the mound, fits that description perfectly.From a roster-building standpoint, the fit is clear. Baltimore needs a front-of-the-rotation pitcher, and Cease is one of the few available starters capable of performing at that level. At approximately $13.75 million, he also lands in a salary tier that allows the Orioles to add premium talent without dismantling future financial plans.Considering the increasing frustration around small-market spending trends across MLB, a signing like this would also help reinforce that Baltimore remains committed to contending rather than cutting back.If the Orioles intend to stay competitive in the American League, anchoring the rotation must be the first priority. Cease checks every box the franchise is searching for - affordability, upside, proven dominance, and the ability to immediately stabilize a rotation that lost two key arms.Also read: MLB trade rumors: Tampa Bay Rays expected to pursue $115.5 million veteran Philadelphia Phillies catcher to address key roster weakness As Kline notes, Baltimore simply needs a reliable, top-end option. If they decide to act aggressively in free agency, Dylan Cease may indeed become the most logical - and highest-impact - path forward as they search for their next ace.
Article Summary: San diego padres star dylan cease is a former cy young candidate entering the market at roughly $13.75 million. Zach eflin is hitting free agency and grayson rodriguez has been traded to the anaheim angels. Baltimore needs a front-of-the-rotation pitcher, and cease fits that description perfectly.

Article Title: Once MacKenzie Scott borrowed $1,000 from her friend to pay college fees, now the billionaire is returning the favour
Article Text:
MacKenzie Scott‚Äôs path from borrower to major philanthropist

A philanthropic approach shaped by access, equity and scale

A full circle story of kindness and opportunity





MacKenzie Scott, one of the world‚Äôs most influential philanthropists, has come full circle after once relying on a friend‚Äôs financial help to stay in college. As a Princeton undergraduate, Scott faced dropping out when she could not afford $1,000 in fees, until her roommate Jeannie Tarkenton secured the money for her. Decades later, Scott, now a billionaire, is backing Tarkenton‚Äôs student-lending startup in a gesture many see as a symbolic return of kindness.Scott has written that the experience of receiving help at a vulnerable moment influenced her views on generosity. Her former roommate recalls finding her in tears and arranging the $1,000 loan that allowed Scott to continue her studies at Princeton. Decades later, she is effectively repaying that act by becoming a financial backer of the company her former roommate went on to build, channelling resources into the same kind of students who face the struggles she once did. The story has resurfaced as Scott continues to direct her wealth toward expanding educational access, equity, and economic opportunity.With a net worth estimated at around 34 billion dollars, Scott has given away more than 19 billion dollars since her 2019 divorce from Amazon founder Jeff Bezos , in which she received a substantial shareholding. Rather than establishing a traditional foundation or maintaining a public philanthropy profile, she became known for issuing surprise, unrestricted grants to organisations serving disadvantaged communities, often without seeking attention or public credit.Tarkenton, the roommate who helped Scott stay enrolled, later founded Funding U, a for-profit lending company offering merit-based loans to low-income students who lack co-signers. Scott has become a key financial supporter of the venture, providing capital that reduces risk for banks and makes it possible for more students to secure funding. The company assesses applicants based on academic records, internship experience, and likelihood of completing a degree, a model supporters say better reflects the realities of first-generation and low-income students.Following her divorce, Scott launched a large-scale giving initiative that directed billions of dollars to organisations across the United States. Her donations have supported education, community development, women‚Äôs initiatives, food access, and poverty reduction. Among her most widely recognised contributions were major gifts to Historically Black Colleges and Universities, as well as tribal, Indigenous-serving, and community colleges that had rarely received major private donations in the past.Scott once relied on a small loan to stay in university, and she is now supporting a venture designed to ensure other students do not face the same barrier. The renewed connection between Scott and Tarkenton highlights how early experiences can shape long-term commitments to expanding opportunity and educational access. What began as a modest favour between friends has evolved into an initiative reaching students across the country, demonstrating how individual acts of support can grow into broader systems of opportunity.
Article Summary: Mackenzie scott once relied on a small loan to stay in university. She is now supporting a venture designed to ensure other students do not face the same barrier. The story has resurfaced as scott continues to direct her wealth toward expanding educational access, equity, and economic opportunity.

Article Title: Uber launches fully driverless robotaxis in Abu Dhabi, marking first in the Middle East
Article Text:
Uber and WeRide launched Level 4 driverless robotaxis in Abu Dhabi, operating on Yas Island zones/Image: Uber

Autonomous rides now available in Abu Dhabi



Background of Uber and WeRide partnership



Global expansion and industry context



Service details and passenger experience







Uber has officially introduced fully driverless rides in Abu Dhabi, partnering with Chinese autonomous vehicle company WeRide. This launch marks the first commercial robotaxi service without a human driver in the Middle East and expands Uber‚Äôs autonomous vehicle operations beyond the United States.Riders in Abu Dhabi can now request a WeRide robotaxi through UberX or Uber Comfort. There is also a new ‚ÄúAutonomous‚Äù ride category, the first dedicated self driving option globally on Uber‚Äôs platform. After two weeks of private trials, the service went live on November 26, operating initially in designated areas of Yas Island. On board support is available via the app and through an in vehicle tablet, ensuring passenger safety and assistance during rides.WeRide confirmed that public commercial operations have started without a vehicle specialist on board. The robotaxis are fully autonomous, achieving Level 4 automation. This means the vehicles can manage all driving tasks and respond to road situations independently within approved zones. Although human intervention is not required, the system includes protocols to safely stop the vehicle and allows manual takeover if necessary.Uber and WeRide first began their collaboration in Abu Dhabi in December 2024, initially offering autonomous rides with a safety operator. The partnership expanded to Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, in October 2025, with similar services. Earlier this year, Uber rolled out robotaxi services in Austin and Atlanta, and in Phoenix in late 2023 through Alphabet‚Äôs Waymo.The companies plan to further expand the Abu Dhabi service by the end of 2025 to cover more areas within the city‚Äôs core, including Al Reem and Al Maryah. Currently, WeRide operates over 100 robotaxis in the Middle East and maintains a first mover advantage in the UAE, having been active in autonomous vehicle operations since 2021. In 2023, WeRide became the first company in the UAE to receive a national license allowing all types of self driving vehicles to be tested and operated on public roads, subject to local approvals.WeRide has already deployed fully driverless services in Beijing and Guangzhou, China, while Uber continues to expand its autonomous vehicle operations globally. In May 2025, Uber announced plans to introduce WeRide robotaxis in 15 additional cities, including locations in Europe, over the next five years. The company has also secured a six year robotaxi agreement with electric vehicle maker Lucid and autonomous vehicle startup Nuro.Competitors are adopting similar technology. Lyft, for example, partnered with Waymo in September 2025 to launch robotaxi services in Nashville next year. Despite these moves, Uber has not disclosed how revenue from autonomous rides is shared with its partners.In Abu Dhabi, passengers can increase their chances of getting a robotaxi by selecting the autonomous option in the app. The vehicles operate in designated zones with safety measures built in, including on-board support and the ability for passengers to interact with the system through a tablet. The robotaxis promise hands-free driving in approved areas while maintaining safety protocols that allow the vehicle to stop or enable manual intervention if needed.This launch represents a significant milestone for both Uber and WeRide, expanding the reach of autonomous vehicles in the Middle East and demonstrating the commercial viability of fully driverless robotaxis outside the US and China.
Article Summary: Uber and weride launched level 4 driverless robotaxis in abu dhabi, operating on yas island zones. This launch marks the first commercial robotaxi service without a human driver in the middle east. On board support is available via the app and through an in vehicle tablet, ensuring passenger safety and assistance during rides.

Article Title: How to watch Burj Khalifa New Year Eve fireworks: Your epic guide to front-row seats and prices
Article Text:
Epic guide to Burj Khalifa New Year views / Image: File

Free front row seats at Burj Park

Dubai‚Äôs VIP dining showdown

The Ultra-Elite Table: At high-end spots like G√ºnaydin in Souk Al Bahar, the most exclusive premium tables (think two tables total) can hit a staggering Dh12,000 per person. This typically includes a set menu and premium beverages.

Premium Dining: Other high-view venues like The Meat Co charge a minimum spend of Dh5,000 for a lower terrace seat.

Fast Food, High Price: Even the casual spots get in on the action! You can expect to pay around Dh2,200 per person for a "gold table" (outdoor view) at places like Five Guys (unlimited burgers and shakes included!). Other casual dining outdoor spots like TGI Fridays start around Dh3,000.

The Small Catch: When booking a restaurant package, remember a critical detail: most restaurants on The Dubai Mall Promenade and Souk Al Bahar are dry venues, meaning they are unable to serve alcohol. Confirm your beverage package before you book if a celebratory drink is part of your NYE plan.

Looking ahead





Dubai doesn't just ring in the New Year; it throws a party so massive the entire world watches. The Burj Khalifa spectacular is a perfect mix of pyrotechnics, laser choreography, and dazzling multi-sensory effects. If you're looking to score the best view, you need a strategy, and a budget.The good news? The celebration has been supersized this year into an eight-day mega extravaganza, turning Downtown Dubai into the planet‚Äôs biggest open-air stage. Here is your definitive, step-by-step guide on how to be part of the show, from the hardcore free viewer to the ultra-luxury diner.Want a guaranteed, great view without sacrificing your entire day to sidewalk sitting? Emaar offers a brilliant middle-ground solution with its official ticketed event at Burj Park. Your ticket guarantees you a prime spot with an unobstructed sightline of the massive spectacle, no towering strangers or accidental trees in your frame.This year, the park is hosting a special Bollywood-themed experience in collaboration with Shah Rukh Khan‚Äôs Frontstage, promising blockbuster energy, live performances, and a festival atmosphere. The venue includes access to dedicated live entertainment, kids‚Äô workshops, and a variety of food and beverage trucks and stalls to keep you fueled (Note: Food and drinks are purchased separately).You must collect your access badge between December 26 and 30. No badge, no entry on December 31. Doors open early, usually at 12:00 PM.If money is truly no object and your idea of enjoyment involves fine dining with the world‚Äôs tallest tower as your backdrop, the restaurants facing the Burj Khalifa are your stage.Restaurants in Souk Al Bahar and The Dubai Mall Promenade transform into exclusive viewing balconies for one night only, with prices skyrocketing to secure that coveted front-row table.The Price of Luxury (Per Person Minimum Spend):The most budget-friendly way to see the magic is from the free public viewing areas spread across Downtown Dubai. However, be prepared to embrace the crowds and the hustle. To secure any decent viewing spot close to the action, you must be ready for an extreme wait. Dedicated spectators often arrive up to 12 hours before midnight to stake their claim.Downtown Dubai becomes highly congested on New Year's Eve. Roads around the area, including the Dubai Mall, typically start closing as early as 4:00 PM, making arrival and departure a serious planning exercise.For those a bit further back, or stuck in the inevitable crowd, large LED screens will be set up along Sheikh Mohammed Bin Rashid Boulevard, streaming the live entertainment and the countdown show in real-time.Whether you‚Äôre setting your alarm for a dawn arrival to claim your free spot, securing the smart ticket to the spectacular Burj Park party, or clinking glasses at a dazzling Dh12,000 VIP table, the Burj Khalifa guarantees one of the world's most unforgettable welcomes to the New Year.The choice comes down to time versus budget, but the payoff remains the same: an explosion of awe, an unforgettable countdown, and a spectacular memory to start the year. Get ready for the lights, the action, and the energy, because in Dubai, the New Year isn't just celebrated, it's a global, front-row experience.
